website_summaries.verdict: A highly accurate sight, but its housing doesn’t hold up well on high-powered rifles.
pros: Windage and elevation adjustment dials make a reassuring click with each turn
Aim holds true even after hundreds of rounds fired
cons: Big jump in brightness between settings 3 and 4, which can be jarring
Dot can disappear after a few shots
Battery cover may fly off when used with higher powered rifles

customer_reviews.title: Best red dot for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many red dots including an EO Tech and I used Aimpoint red dots in the military. This red dot is just as good as the more expensive red dot sights. I have old man vision but I find the dot to be very sharp and crisp and I was able to zero easily and accurately with only a few rounds. Save the money and buy three of these for the price of the competitors. I can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Dot kept disappearing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this is June, finally got to use it this weekend... Fired a few shots with my AK and then the Dot disappeared. Thought it was weird, so i cranked up the intensity to max level and it reappeared. Fired another magazine, and it disappeared halfway through again. My dad had the same problem when he was shooting, and I had it happen again at the end of the day. Not sure if it came with a bad battery, or if it's faulty. Not sure if the recoil of the AK is too much for this thing to handle or what.
customer_reviews.author: P S

customer_reviews.title: Will never use anything else
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat these sights. I have the advanced version and its amazing. This one is half the price and is just as tough and the image just as sharp. Only difference is knob controls and the battery only last 1000 hours. I cant see myself spending a grip on sights. Not the guy to go buy an eotech or a 900 aim point. For about 100 bux it doesnt get better than this, especially for the gunnyou take out every now and then. If you're thinking about buying this for your primary rifle i highly suggest the advanced version.
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: but so far I am very happy with it I will try to update after it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go along with a Primary Arms 3x Gen III Red Dot Magnifier and Primary Arms Basic flip to Side Magnifier. If you are going to buy the same setup, you will also need a riser for the Red Dot Sight. I overlooked this on my original purchase. I was not sure what size to get, but after a quick call to Primary Arms, I knew I needed a Primary Arms Lower 1/3 Cowitness Micro Dot Riser, which I promptly ordered. I have not had a chance to take it to the range yet, but so far I am very happy with it I will try to update after it has seen more use.
customer_reviews.author: superkj3

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money - above average micro-dot.
customer_reviews.text: I relied heavily on other 5-star reviews in deciding to purchase a Primary Arms Micro Red Dot Sight ... and I was not disappointed!! I mounted it on a .40 cal platform and put 50 rounds through it ... 10 for zero and a fast 40 for fun. It held zero - no movement (no Loctite used). The dial increments are crisp and the red dot is plenty bright. Only took it out for a stroll this once - but I'm happy with it. I'll add more to this if there's anything worth posting...
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Great optic at a great price point
customer_reviews.text: Great little red dot. I have it on a 7.62x39 rifle and it has stayed zeroed through approx 500 rounds. Seems like the build quality is strong. For an optic on a range toy, I don't know why you'd spend 2-5x more on other brands. Eye relief and the size of the tube work well for short to medium distance. I haven't had any issues hitting a 12" steel target out to 150 yards. I haven't tried it farther. I may buy another for a 300 BLK SBR I'm putting together. It should be perfect in that role also.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzbuster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scope. Obviously not an Aimpoint
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scope. Obviously not an Aimpoint, but for the price, VERY comparable. I have two AP H2's on other guns and bought this for a gun I don't shoot as often. Holds zero, clear picture, clear dot, (Vortex, I'm looking at you). Well worth the money for this dot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Sight turns off unexpectedly
customer_reviews.text: Edit: After several extended range sessions I'm disappointed with the quality of these micro red-dots. An earlier favorable review was based on very limited range time, but now that I have run several hundred rounds through my Scorpions I find that the sights turn off and on at random. Annoying at the range, but would be a critical failure in an actual SD scenario. While they are cosmetically nice, this is not acceptable for a serious optic. Will upgrade shortly.... One possible cause that I need to confirm is whether tightening the battery door all the way down will prevent this. Next range trip will see if this was the case. If so, still annoying...
customer_reviews.author: Jordean

customer_reviews.title: Less build quality than some $30 units
customer_reviews.text: Just get a vortex or Holosun and you will be happy. This unit wasn’t sealed and the build quality wasn’t worth the price. Lense clarity on par with low cost brands. All of these are made in China but with red dots you do get what you pay for. I have other primary arms products that are great. This was not the case with this unit
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought this red dot on Amazon. The first one I got was way cheaper. After I bought it, they took them off the website very quickly. I decided to buy a second one and might buy a few more. Don't get me wrong, these are not AimPoint quality. But these are priced at the average working person's budget and perform good enough. I put one on my AR pistol, CZ Scorpion pistol and will get on for my shotgun.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Gun

customer_reviews.title: Good for money
customer_reviews.text: I put mine on a ras 47 with the century mount , mounts well and their was locktight included in the package . (Unexpected but welcome) dot is clear and crisp when adjusted to light conditions. Came with the torx head tool to mount . I didn't use the pic rail mount so limited info their . Overall very pleased with this optic , I will update when zeroed and ran though a few mags .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sight for the money, but it is worth upgrading the the "Advanced Dot"
customer_reviews.text: Comes as advertised. Great fit and finish. Id say its 90% as good as Aimpoint for 1/5th of the cost. Slight tint to the glass but nowhere near as bad as something like an RMR, still perfectly useable. Controls were nice and positive. I ran the sight pretty hard, 300 rounds mounted on a Glock 20 and 700 rounds mounted on various other rifles. Never lost zero nor any other failures. Really no complaints. Only thing I would say is that I do think it is worth paying the extra 30-40 bucks to get the Advanced Dot. Every bit as tough as this sight but with 49k more hours of battery life. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Connor Orton

customer_reviews.title: An aimpoint for 1/4 the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these. I have used them on ARs and 12 ga shotguns. I love them. They just work well. Nice small reticle, no failures, holds zero. I just don't know why you would spend 4x the money for the aimpoint. Aimpoints are great. They just don't have much more to offer than these.
customer_reviews.author: xcalibur1000

customer_reviews.title: Hmm...
customer_reviews.text: Well, it showed up not functioning. Wasn't sure if it was the battery or if the scope was defective. I contacted Primary Arms and complained. The company responded saying that they would send me a new battery (which I never received) and would replace or refund it if it's defective. I ended up buying another battery and that did the trick but when you pay this kind of price I expect a little more. The "Made in China" stamp on the bottom of the scope should have given me a clue...
customer_reviews.author: Adam Angeloff

customer_reviews.title: Best microdot scope value on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microdot scope based on all the positive reviews. When I got it, I was really impressed by the way it was packaged and how well-built it appeared to be. I haven't been able to mount it to my .22 rifle, yet, but I imagine it will perform well when I do. I had bought a Mueller microdot scope some years ago that was more money and of very poor quality. I could have gotten a lemon, I don't know. This Primary Arms microdot scope is superior in every way and a considerable bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Randall England

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this sight
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this sight. But, the parallax occurs at 11 O'clock. Meaning, when you're if you move your eye the red dot shoots up to 11 O'clock which is weird. There's also a slight bevel to the lens which also cause the dot to move when it gets near the lens bevel. I expected more from this sight. Not acceptable. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great dot, with an issue.
customer_reviews.text: Received this item today. Prompt shipping from primary arms as always. Every looked great. This being my 4th primary arms optic I was surprised to see the front lense to be installed improperly. Without firing it I cannot say if the lense will malfunction or not but its slightly disappointing. Email sent to primary arms and waiting in reply. Aside from the lense issue the quality seems fantastic. Update. Was informed this cant in lense is normal. If that's the case it is easily a 5 star transaction as always with primary arms.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this optic
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this optic. Bought the fieldsport one for $24 for my 10/22, and immediately regretted it. Bought this one as a replacement, and it is VERY solid. Right out of the box, I only had to make a few adjustments to zero it in at 15 yards. Had to continue to make "slight" adjustments as I continues varying the distance, but within 50 rounds got it so that it is pretty much dead on from 50 yards and in. Don't make the same mistake I did, spend the $90 and get a still very good bargain on an excellent red dot.
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: Fine product!
customer_reviews.text: I was delighted to order and receive my Primary Arms M-dot sight. The order and the shipping were processed quickly. The red dot was packaged well. Upon opening the red dot, I noted its fine construction. It seems durable and the controls were intuitive. The base was solid and co-witnessed with my iron sights with little difficulty. I wanted a solid sight for my Panzer Arms AR-12 and I believe I got just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schuring

customer_reviews.title: Worked right up until I used it the first time. Then quit before the first shot.
customer_reviews.text: The dot stopped working as I attempted to sight it in, never got a shot off. It lights up randomly at home, tried a new battery, didn't help. I should have gone to the range sooner, I am 5 days past the return window. Couldn't give it zero stars, one is too high a rating. This is the second time Primary Arms has burned me. PSA gets all my business now.
customer_reviews.author: Terre

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This red dot works well and you can't bet the price. Been using it on 9mm carbine and it works very well. I've put about 500 rounds through the carbine with this optic attached and it has held zero just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: markings on turrets are reversed
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these Primary Arms micro red dots and I like all 3, however the last 2 I bought have the markings on the turrets reversed, so left is right, and up is actually down, it's not hard to see the dot move inside the sight with relationship to the iron sight it co-witnesses with on my rifle, so this won't keep anyone from sighting in the sight to the firearm, just an inconvenience. These work well on any firearm, including shotguns, best deal around. There are several You Tube videos where people torture these sights beyond what I would do, and they keep working.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little scope for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little scope for the price. Arrived in mail on delivery date promised and it good condition. Had it attached to my 10/22 Ruger in minutes using the rail that came with the 10/22 when I purchased it. Took it to range and was able to sight it with minimal adjustments. Really like how you are able to change intensity of dot.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Husband

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: You probably won't find a better red dot for the price and after purchasing this I'm done with paying the premiums for Aimpoints or Eotechs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it....now...what you waiting for Bro
customer_reviews.text: bought this for this for the keltec sub 2000. Shot about 200 rounds of 9mm, and it still held zero. It's a well made optic and it should hold up for a while. Going to put it to good use!
customer_reviews.author: R3113R

customer_reviews.title: Mounted it on kel-tec sub 2000 and has held zero ...
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on kel-tec sub 2000 and has held zero thru 100 rounds. Would give it 5 star because of its value/performance and ease of zeroing.
customer_reviews.author: David Walkki

customer_reviews.title: Quality Optic & Budget Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son and he loves it! Very high quality made product! He was Very impressed at how well it works on his Kel-Tec Sub 2000. Very well packaged and arrived quickly! Will be ordering a few more of these for other rifles we have! Well done Primary Arms!
customer_reviews.author: Just a Sassy Mom in Arkansas

customer_reviews.title: and i really like the brightness settings
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is top notch. I used a bore sighter to sight it at 25 yards, and it was dead on at the range. Held zero after 100 rounds, and i really like the brightness settings. It is sensitive enough between settings to get the right brightness for any lighting, and the dot is nice and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of reading and watching videos about this little red dot before I decided to purchase it, and I couldn't be more pleased. I mounted it on my AK47 and after dragging it around in the woods, getting it covered in dirt and mud, and knocking it around a bit, and a couple hundred rounds I can still says it hasn't changed zero at all. I can't attest to the battery life yet, but I have used it quite a bit and it still hasn't needed replacing.
customer_reviews.author: purdyboy89

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to zero it and it has held its zero ...
customer_reviews.text: The primary arms micro red dot came well packaged and is well made. I mounted it to my AR Carbine and co-witnessed it with my iron sites. I've had it at the range twice now, and put a few hundred rounds down range each time. It was easy to zero it and it has held its zero perfectly. The red dot is clear and bright. It is easy to acquire and has little to no parallax. I am very pleased with this red dot. I've used Aimpoint and Eotech and while this isn't quite as rugged, for my purposes (range and home defense) it works just fine. I plan to buy another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: MDelta

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: For several years, we have been working youth shooting sports. Each year, parents have tons of questions about equipment. This year we have several new kids wanting to shoot air pistol silhouettes so we were looking for an high quality affordable red dot scope when we came across this one. We are very impressed with it and it will be our recommended red dot from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: The mom

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I Got a Dud...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this optic as my first PA since I've heard nothing but good things about the quality for the price. Fit and finish are good, but once I took it to the range, my shooting partner and I noticed that the dot pales in comparison to Bushnell and Vortex. Even on the highest power, the dot is barely visible. We tried in sunny and overcast conditions over several days and I just don't see how anyone could be satisifed with the clarity and brightness. Maybe I got a dud, but for now I'll be saving up for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great..
customer_reviews.text: It works great...for a target pistol or a lefty or both. Wasn't paying attention when I bought it. The control knob is on the right. The main thing I don't like is that the switch won't go from off to full bright. You have to rotate all way around to get to a usable setting in daylight or with tac light on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works with a 357 Magnum just fine
customer_reviews.text: I've probably got 200 rounds through my 686 with this on it now, and it's still working great. I will say that I have an astigmatism, which I believe makes the dot more blurry, but that's not their fault.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: The Right Size for My AK
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to mount on my Midwest Industries AK Railed Scope Mount attached to my Palmetto State Armory PSAK-47. I really like the compactness of the optic.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Cool paper weight now
customer_reviews.text: Decent build quality. Does feel a bit cheap. Two mounting screws came loose at the range while zeroing. Totally blew that days shoot. And yes, I used locktite. Dot is a little dim in bright light. The dot actually winked out for a minute. Shot another round and was there again. Probably won't be returning it. It got kinda nicked up at the range. So yeah. Cool paper weight now.
customer_reviews.author: Tony W.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent sight for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent sight for the money. One thing which I consider a design flaw, is you can only turn it on by clicking the dial starting at 0 and manually clicking through to 10. So if you want it to get to say 7 every time you turn it on. You have to scroll through the levels. Not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: dave carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Optic
customer_reviews.text: This is a premium optic at a very competitive price. The technology is a step above the standard optics companies you’ll find on Amazon, but not quite an Aimpoint or Holosun. For 99% of shooters, this red dot is more than what we need them for. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Nunyabidness

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak to its durability as I've only had it 8 months but its accurate, adjustable and cool beans. Only thing it needs is an auto off as I can't seem to remember to turn it off after destroying targets with my awesome Ruger PC9 carbine.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Great choice! I just bought my second one and they are a great buy. If you can't quite afford that Aimpoint yet, keep saving and be happy with the Primary Arms unit in the meantime. It's a great and rugged little unit. I'll be bubying athird one very soon and yes, I use them on AKs and M-4s.
customer_reviews.author: Norwood

customer_reviews.title: godd product an exceptional price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried this at tge range yet. Installation was easy. Centering the red dot using a bore sigting laser was very easy. Seems solid with good glass. Bonus is that it comes with a nice riser which sets you at the right height.
customer_reviews.author: Carbonride

customer_reviews.title: very cheap price and very cheap product
customer_reviews.text: It is about what you would expect for the money i guess. I was hoping to be pleasantly surprised.... I was not
customer_reviews.author: trip barber

customer_reviews.title: Great sight
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong for the price. I grabbed the riser and all is well. I was bangin away and it held zero. No issues yet. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Enikeev

customer_reviews.title: Great sight but should include a riser
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars because the most common use for this sight would require a riser that is not included and I feel it should be With that being said it’s a great sight I have it on a 10.5” AR pistol build and it zeroed very easily and has held zero but I’m less then 100 rounds since I zeroed it but I have no doubt that it will work flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Karen R.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding value. I mounted it utilizing a Midwest pivoting mount on a Kel-tec sub 2000. Stuck a Feyachi mlok light on the side, and my wife says she now has the perfect bedside 2/4 legged weapon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving a 5 cause this thing is very nice and accurate. ..although when I received it the threads on the sight were stripped. .I fixed them by running a tap and cleaning the threads and replacing the screws...could have happened to any company,I could have returned it but I chose to fix it instead. ..no worries great sight for yhe money
customer_reviews.author: Tommytee

customer_reviews.title: Best sight for the money out there! Bright, clear optic!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sight! Love it on my 5.56 SBR. Best value for this style of sight I've found! As good as if not better than others at twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Knott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Red-Dot for the price and VERY durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding delivery time!! Item was exactly what i expected and packaged very securely. I have a friend whom purchased one and is using it on a AK47 and experienced no issues what so ever. I bought this one for use on my PTR-91 308cal. I figured if it could handle the recoil of the AK then my PTR-91 wouldn't be an issue as well. I'm very well pleased with it and how it maintains zero.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this mount (also available from Amazon) Midwest Industries Gen 2 Sub 2000 T1/T2 Mount to mount this scope on my KelTec sub 2000. This is my first red dot and I found it easy to mount and dial in. The scope and the gun shoot better than I do at 25 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Goski

customer_reviews.title: Turns on, zeros easy, more money for ammo
customer_reviews.text: Love it, perfectly round dot for my older eyes and an almost clear glass lens (slightly tented but not complaining). Also, it came with a sticker.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to zero, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. The sight looks very durable, and has a clear sight picture. The dot brightness has a wide range of brightness settings. The zero settings are easily adjustable. No idea on battery life yet, and I only have about 6 hours of use with it so far. Very happy with this. There are better red dots out there, but not at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Al Thompson

customer_reviews.title: A good red dot for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this 2 MOA red dot for my SIG-522 training rifle. While some may prefer a 4 MOA I wanted the smaller aim point. It was easy to install and to zero in. Since I mainly use it plinking and target shooting it fits the bill nicely. I'd switch to at least a SIG Romeo 5 if I was putting a red dot onto an AR or AK.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. You will be happy
customer_reviews.text: For the money this red dot is very very hard to beat...I have 5 of them now. 2 on ar's 1 on an ak and 2 on standby
customer_reviews.author: gary morris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my 44 mag Black Hawk and it holds zero just fine. Adjustments are accurate. I have not had it long enough to attest to the battery life claims, but the dot is plenty bright and the perfect size for accurate shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Tough micro red dot for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little red dot. Really liked the super small reticle, with larger red dot my eyes want to focus on the big bright dot. Helps me with situational awareness, my attention stays on my target more. Having an astigmatism makes most dots longer dashes, with this one I hardly notice it.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several expensive red dot sights in the past. This performs just as well if not better. Can't beat the price. Holds zero and easy to adjust. I put this on an AR project build with a 3/4in riser.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Another great value from Primary Arms. Very well made, nice feel to the controls and excellent range of adjustment. After laser bore sighting, it was on paper. After one set of 5 shots, I measured the distance off center, turned the adjustments the appropriate number of clicks per the markings on the turrets and was zeroed. Repeated groups on my AK showed no sign of drifting. Doesn't get any better that that.
customer_reviews.author: R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Major POS. It broke just sitting around doing nothing. They were happy to offer replacement but why replace with another POS? Same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic dot optic for the price; will be ordering additional units!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, durable and inexpensive dot. I have it on my M70 underfolder, mounted on the Ultimak pic rail. Super easy to zero and held zero through one session, and I can't imagine why it wouldn't continue to hold zero. Even came with rubber lens covers. I will be ordering another for my Mossberg 930SPX soon. You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: scooterdavis

customer_reviews.title: Nice little red dote
customer_reviews.text: Sweet red dot primary arm is a great company to buy anything to upgrade your firearm I deffintly recommend this . Only thing is I wished they would add the extended base to the red dot package instead of having an person make two separate purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this on a New Ruger Mark IV Lite 22/45 pistol. Easy to zero, very accurate.My 2nd Red Dot from Primary arms.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fargo

customer_reviews.title: great for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I placed this beauty on my air gun and has held zero for the past 450 rounds!.... the battery seems to be holding up well. I think its a good buy at the price point.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, very easy to zero in , very sturdy, the light adjustments are very useful and easy
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as specified!
customer_reviews.text: Less expensive Red Dot alternative! Mounted on a Ruger PC9. Easy to sight in and has consistently held zero!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I received my primary arms red dot fairly quickly. It seems fairly well made. The dot is fairly small at low intensity. It blurs a little when turned up. But it shouldn't affect my accuracy too much as I have it mounted on an Ak47. All in all, I was moist impressed. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality optic, nice price
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this review by saying that I am a mid-priced sight guy as I do not rely on these sights to defend my life. I refuse to pay a premium for EOTech or Aimpoint, but also won't buy the cheapest stuff out there because I expect to enjoy target shooting, This sight fits the bill perfectly. It sighted in quickly, held zero, and shot flawlessly. It is amazingly quick to acquire target, it's crisp, and above all, it makes target shooting fun. Thank you Primary Arms for producing a reasonably priced, quality optic.
customer_reviews.author: Rick W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Really good quality. Better than paying the High $$ for an aimpoint or Eotech..Holds POA. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G Bel

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Put one on my Red Army standard AK mount. Bolted right up, holds dot intensity and zero @ 50yds. I have over 300 casings to prove it! Excellent product for your dollar!
customer_reviews.author: Glockomatic

customer_reviews.title: however the support from Primary Arms has been Great. Very helpful and caring that their product is ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the lineament, however the support from Primary Arms has been Great . Very helpful and caring that their product is doing its job properly.
customer_reviews.author: E.K.

customer_reviews.title: Good scope. I bought it for my ar pistol ...
customer_reviews.text: Good scope. I bought it for my ar pistol build. It's comparable to the aimpoint I have that's 3x the price, for the most part. The aimpoint is better at brighter settings. The PA turns into a starburst at 9+, which isn't great, but for the price it's a good scope. Put 300 rounds down range with it, and it's held zero.
customer_reviews.author: jkel

customer_reviews.title: Nice red dot at a very nice price
customer_reviews.text: Nice red dot at a very nice price! Held zero very well and was light and perfect co-witness on my CX4 Storm carbine. No riser blocks were needed. Will buy again if I need another
customer_reviews.author: Donald Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Really good rds.
customer_reviews.text: Use this for airsoft. Its slim and easy to adjust. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Waidalicious

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great optic for a great price. So far, it has held zero through a few hundred rounds it was very simple to sight in on my AR
customer_reviews.author: crambone

customer_reviews.title: great red dot! light and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Solid little red dot that is compact and doesn't look like a POS. I have used this between several AR's and it has taken the abuse with ease. It has maintained its accuracy, and Primary Arms is just an awesome company. I highly recommend this if you want something practical, and not overly bulky and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: The dot is very crisp when adjusted for it's current light setting although the sight picture is kinda small even with both eyes open. Is advertised as 1000 hr battery life but I haven't even used my sight for 3 days and the laser is already too dim to see outside. I have been turning it off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah28

customer_reviews.title: Better than my 4 Bushnel TR-25
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Positive clicks & Clear. Love the position of the diode.
customer_reviews.author: Ironballs

customer_reviews.title: Battery included?
customer_reviews.text: The battery was included, installed and powered at the 5 setting. So the battery was dead - Is this a new item? The mount screw use "star" style head not an allen - why? I installed another battery and the Red Dot worked and looked fine. Will update this review when I have some time to use the sight.
customer_reviews.author: John Michelini

customer_reviews.title: survived my MAK90
customer_reviews.text: i did the RD build on 1 of my MAK90's, put this on the ultimak ak gas tube rail . still banging, accurate and cowitness all day long . good for CQC - 200yds . this was for testing, now running trijicon mro red dot . this is now on my Remington 870 Express . survived
customer_reviews.author: MR. GREEN

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Built like a brick sh** house. Can't kill it. Will trust my life to these
customer_reviews.author: Hunter H.

customer_reviews.title: An initial inspection.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for a family member for Christmas. I inspected the unit before wrapping and the optic and the packaging were flawless. The pictures do not do it justice. I wish the anodizing on my colt was as nice as this. And if the other reviews are any indication, it will be a solid performer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keltec 2000 / mid west red dot mount
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased, after buying the mount for the keltec 2000 it fits perfect and is accurate
customer_reviews.author: david clark

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Just un boxed and mounted on my little .22 and it looks at home. All controls are stiff and i wish you could rotate the brightness both directions from zero. After a day at the range 5 stars, I rarely give 5
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Testing the first one now.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the sight picture but it didn't cost like my Aimpoint Comp Ms either. If it holds up, will get a couple of more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: As described and works great. Now if only it could me me shoot great! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Tamra Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little Red-Dot
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little Red-Dot. Does what its intended to do - Display a red dot. Absolutely don't need to burn $500 on a Aimpoint or similar overpriced Red-Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Goran

customer_reviews.title: One of the best red dots I've ever used for the money
customer_reviews.text: One of the best red dots I've ever used for the money. Very similar to an Atibal not quite vortex sparc but you can't beat the price. Run it on AR9 so I am not sure how it handles something with more punch.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Calouche

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase. I had returned the bushnell TR-25 as it would not work with my mounting system. Right away I could tell that the Primary Arms unit's quality was far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: This was a decent item. I didn’t like it enough to keep it though. Got something else shortly after purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: jseng

customer_reviews.title: Best red dot value on the market IMHO
customer_reviews.text: Best red dot value on the market IMHO. This is an excellent sight at a good price. The dot is a very crisp image. As a caveat, I have not yet used this sight in very bright sunlight so I cannot attest to it working in bright light conditions. I like this sight so much I plan to buy two more.
customer_reviews.author: Kryptonite

customer_reviews.title: Awesome red dot for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome red dot for the price, this has a very fine reticle and is almost as good as the pricier red dots. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: xXx

customer_reviews.title: Smaller dot
customer_reviews.text: Very compact, well built, great sight for the money, would highly recommend. I like the smaller dot. I would prefer green.
customer_reviews.author: JED

customer_reviews.title: Matching red dot sight with riser mount and using a 6x magnifier.
customer_reviews.text: Love how light it is. Love the fact that you can stick it on your rail within seconds and be running with it. I use the UTG compact riser mount, size medium, 3 slot rail on my setup and I recently purchased the 6x magnifier with the flip to the side mount and that setup is perfect. The magnifier lense is slightly larger than the lense on this red sight, so it centers perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Troy S Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great optic, durable and bright
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a 50 Beowulf, zeroed, and fired 30 full power rounds. Optic is still perfectly zeroed and no issues. I am very happy to see that it is holding up to what is basically 12 gauge recoil with no problems at all. Excellent dot clarity, brightness is adjustable to much brighter than necessary for daylight
customer_reviews.author: john wargo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and adjust - I had to buy a spacer to raise it a bit. Display is bright and clear and the red dot intensity adjustment allows for use in any lighting condition.
customer_reviews.author: JMarshall

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, a little better than Bushnell TRS25, a little more expensive too.
customer_reviews.author: Audiohobbist

customer_reviews.title: Clear Red Dot, Easy to Adjust, Low Profile
customer_reviews.text: I needed something low profile for a light weight, no frills build. This fit the bill and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get a lot better tha the bargain ones
customer_reviews.text: Spend a little more and get a lot better tha the bargain ones. Came w/bikini cover. The "double dot" that you hear about on the internet does not exist if used correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H

customer_reviews.title: AK47's best red for price
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised ,had to tweak the TWS mount to allow to fit proper.Fault of mount not sight.took less than 10shots to get in 2" group at 100yds.Makes AK47 a fun and accurate(reasonably) weapon, my go to coyote take down tool.762 x39 is fun and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph R Becker

customer_reviews.title: After Zero Adjustments this Red Dot is very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very easy. Adjustment was easy. I didn't like that the red dot was a little blurred on the right side..
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Great red dot optic for a very good price
customer_reviews.text: Great red dot optic for a very good price. It works as expected and continues to take a licking. My only complaint is that the writing on the side has smudged somewhat, but that does not affect the functionality. I still give it 5 stars because it works and its inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

product_meta.title: Primary Arms Classic Series Compact Red Dot Sight Gen II with Removable Mount
feature_bullets: 2 MOA RED DOT: The canted front lens design reflects the crisp 2 MOA dot projected by the emitter into the eye of the shooter for quick shots at short ranges and effective shots at medium ranges
ILLUMINATION: Powered by a common CR2032 battery, this red dot features 11 illumination settings with approx. 1,000 hours of battery life when used on a medium setting
RUGGED AND DURABLE: Constructed of 6061 aluminum housing with a durable black hardcoat anodized finish and O-ring sealed for protection from water and fog
INCLUDED: A removable Picatinny rail mount and CR2032 battery are included for easy set-up right out of the box along with a bikini lens cover for glass protection
1-YEAR WARRANTY: We’ve got you covered for a year after purchase – If a defect due to materials or workmanship has caused your product to malfunction, Primary Arms will either repair or replace it

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
